intro: Velaea howellii, commonly known as the Howell's velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
